text: Hi there, I talked with Brian Halligan 3 months ago in an Event in Spain about the feasable chance that HubSpot CMS gets the status of Stand Alone service. He said HubSpot was considering seriously about it and that we'll have news about it sooner than later. Have you admins any news about this?
Hey <@U2Q5LPHGS>. It's something we're still figuring out. I'll DM you to chat more.
I saw a survey about it a while back that seemed to imply that as well.

Not sure if this is related to the CMS or not, but I keep running across some HubSpot subdomains where the CSS won’t load. Example - <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/now-live-updated-deal-forecast-widget>
hmm, working for me. Can you get the response headers of that 400 on the css file?
well now that I go back to it, it’s loading fine for me as well. But it’s been a recurring issue for a few weeks. I’ll dig into response headers if I see it again.
Just had it pop up again and when I went into the network panel to record it, of course, loaded correctly. However, it didn’t show any CSS files under the network tab. Which is strange.
Have you checked you ad blocker?
